content: increase repeat last 2 row once 10sts forelegs working on one leg at a time fold the leg in half row 6-8 work 3 row st st matching row ends and mattress sew across the cast-off edge at the row 9 increase kfb k1 5 times 15sts hoof then join along the seam up to the last 5 row the leg top row 10-12 work 3 row st st curve stuff the leg fairly firmly join around this curve onto the body referring to the images for placement leg seam faces inwards inside leg straight edge backside seam fig 10 right leg lamb page 20 lamb page 21 to complete abbreviations embroider a tiny nose and mouth then work a y shape around k = knit p = purl increase = increase decrease = decrease the nose and above the mouth m1 = make one foll = follows k2 decrease = knit two together work straight stitches at the centre of each hoof to create the repeat = repeat rh/lh = right hand/ left hand rs/ws = right side/ wrong cloven hoof side st/ sts =stitch/ stitches cont = continue skpo = slip one stitch knit next stitch pass slipped stitch over knit stitch note lamb s legs are a little wobbly if you wish him to stand you kfb = knit into front then into back of stitch to increase by one stitch may like to add small narrow wooden dowels cake making dowels beg = beginning rem = remaining for example into his legs note if there is any part of this pattern that you do not understand then please feel free to email me claire garland@btopenworld com to see more and details on how to get a free knitting pattern every other month follow along with @dotpebbles_knits on instagram https //www instagram com/dotpebbles_knits/
